Dear Prof. Goodwin,

first of all, thanks for the Cantera-1.4 release - it =
is much more 
structured than the old ones. I=B4m using Cantera mostly for =
research 
code development using plug-flow-reactors.

My question is, if it=
 is now necessary to define a wall for an 
reactor to set the heat transfer=
 to non-adiabatic values? If I use 
the "setHeatTransferCoeff()"-function f=
or an reactor it doesn=B4t have 
any effect.

Another question is if you ar=
e planning to implement Sensitivity 
Analysis. There is an Code "cvodes" fr=
om sundials which offers some 
functionality in this direction. If you want=
 I will try to implement 
it in cantera on my own and make some suggestions=
 how you could make 
it official?

Third question: is it possible to constr=
uct flame between two 
opposing nozzles (like oppdif in CH*MKIN) from the o=
ne-dim class?

I hope it isn=B4t to much and look forward to your answers.
=

best regards
ulf
